bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 87 (Wednesday, May 19, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOOLENAAR:H.R. 3349.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 1 of the Constitution.[Page H2613]

item.name: Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee
Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
Rural Disaster Support and Relief Act

This bill retroactively expands access to certain federal disaster relief for local governments and certain public and nonprofit facilities.

Specifically, it increases the federal share of disaster relief assistance for emergencies or disasters declared in calendar years 2020 and 2021 for local governments with populations of less than 50,000.

bill.title: Rural Disaster Support and Relief Act

item.title: Rural Disaster Support and Relief Act

To increase for calendar years 2020 and 2021 the amount of the Federal share for disaster relief and emergency assistance for a local government with a population of less than 50,000, and for other purposes.
Rural Disaster Support and Relief Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, and Emergency Management.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
